long: Meaning: a "branch" (as "extending"); figuratively, a "tribe"; also a "rod", whether for chastising (figuratively, "correction"), ruling (a "sceptre"), throwing (a "lance"), or walking (a "staff"; figuratively, a "support" of life, e.g. bread).  Usage: rod, staff, tribe.  Source: or (feminine) "מַטָּה"; from "H5186";
